Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure CLI
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Azure CLI to create an ExpressRoute Direct circuit. This involves specifying the ExpressRoute port, resource group, SKU family, SKU tier, bandwidth, and location.

Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure Portal
Tasks.Task Description: Navigate to the Azure portal, search for ExpressRoute Direct, and follow the steps to create a new ExpressRoute Direct resource by specifying the subscription, resource group, region, and other configuration details.
Generate the LOA for the ExpressRoute Direct resource using the Azure CLI by specifying the resource name, resource group, customer name, and optionally the file location to store the document.
Enable or disable the admin state for primary and secondary links of the ExpressRoute Direct port using the Azure CLI.
Monitor and track the provisioned and utilized bandwidth for the ExpressRoute Direct circuits to ensure optimal usage and avoid over-provisioning.
Follow the workflow to set up ExpressRoute Direct, including configuring the necessary peering locations and bandwidth options.

Ensure all prerequisites are met before setting up ExpressRoute Direct, including reviewing the ExpressRoute FAQ, finding a connectivity provider, and understanding the Azure Well-Architected Framework for ExpressRoute.
Set up routing for the ExpressRoute circuit, including creating the circuit, configuring routing, and linking a VNet to the ExpressRoute circuit.

Use ExpressRoute Global Reach to enable direct access from on-premises to HANA Large Instance units deployed in different regions or enable direct communication between HANA Large Instance units in different regions.
